fields.name: Influenza (Flu)
fields.description: A common viral infection causing fever, cough, body aches, headache and fatigue.
fields.advice: Rest, drink plenty of fluids, and use fever-reducing or pain-relief medicine if needed and appropriate.
fields.home_remedies: Stay hydrated, use warm fluids, rest in a comfortable position, and use a humidifier if available.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If symptoms last more than 3–5 days, breathing becomes difficult, or you feel very weak.

fields.name: Common cold
fields.description: A mild viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, mainly affecting nose and throat.
fields.advice: Rest, drink fluids, and use basic cold remedies if needed.
fields.home_remedies: Steam inhalation, warm soup or tea, saline nasal rinses, and rest.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If symptoms last more than 10 days, you develop high fever, or symptoms suddenly worsen.

fields.name: Allergic rhinitis (hay fever)
fields.description: An allergy of the nose and eyes, often triggered by pollen, dust, or pets.
fields.advice: Avoid known triggers, keep windows closed during high pollen days, and consider antihistamines if appropriate.
fields.home_remedies: Saline nasal rinses, showering after being outdoors, and using air filters or masks.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If symptoms affect sleep, work, or studies, or do not respond to basic measures.

fields.name: Acute bronchitis
fields.description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes, usually following a cold, causing a persistent cough.
fields.advice: Rest, drink fluids, and avoid smoking or second-hand smoke. Seek medical advice if unsure.
fields.home_remedies: Warm drinks, honey (for adults), and humidified air.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If cough lasts longer than 3 weeks, you cough up blood, or have high fever or breathing difficulty.

fields.name: Pneumonia (suspected)
fields.description: A lung infection in which air sacs may fill with fluid or pus.
fields.advice: Seek medical evaluation promptly. Pneumonia often needs antibiotics or hospital care.
fields.home_remedies: Rest and hydration can support recovery but do not replace professional treatment.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: Immediately if you have high fever, shortness of breath, chest pain, or confusion.

fields.name: Gastroenteritis (stomach infection)
fields.description: An infection of the stomach and intestines causing vomiting, diarrhea, and cramps.
fields.advice: Prevent dehydration by drinking fluids in small, frequent sips and resting.
fields.home_remedies: Oral rehydration solutions, clear fluids, and bland foods like rice or toast when tolerated.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If you cannot keep fluids down, have blood in stool, or signs of severe dehydration.

fields.name: Indigestion / functional dyspepsia
fields.description: Discomfort or pain in the upper abdomen often associated with eating.
fields.advice: Eat smaller meals, avoid trigger foods, and avoid lying down soon after eating.
fields.home_remedies: Warm water, herbal teas, and gentle walking after meals.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If pain is severe, persistent, or associated with weight loss or difficulty swallowing.

fields.name: Urinary tract infection (UTI)
fields.description: Infection in the urinary system, often causing burning and frequent urination.
fields.advice: Increase fluid intake and seek medical advice for possible antibiotics.
fields.home_remedies: Drink water regularly and avoid irritants like caffeine or alcohol.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If you have fever, back pain, blood in urine, or symptoms do not improve within 1–2 days.

fields.name: Tension-type headache
fields.description: A common headache described as pressure or tightness around the head.
fields.advice: Rest, manage stress, and reduce screen time. Simple pain relief may help if appropriate.
fields.home_remedies: Quiet dark room, stretching neck and shoulder muscles, and staying hydrated.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If headaches are very frequent, suddenly very severe, or associated with other worrying symptoms.

fields.name: Migraine-like headache
fields.description: A one-sided, throbbing headache, often with nausea and sensitivity to light or sound.
fields.advice: Rest in a quiet, dark room and avoid known triggers such as certain foods or stress.
fields.home_remedies: Cold or warm compress on the head/neck, relaxation exercises, and regular sleep patterns.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If headaches change pattern, are new and severe, or interfere with daily activities.

fields.name: Generalized anxiety symptoms
fields.description: Physical and emotional symptoms such as worry, restlessness, palpitations, and poor sleep.
fields.advice: Practice relaxation techniques and maintain regular sleep, exercise, and routine.
fields.home_remedies: Deep breathing, mindfulness, and talking with trusted friends or family.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If anxiety affects daily life or you have any thoughts of self-harm.

fields.name: Low mood / depression-like symptoms
fields.description: Persistent low mood, loss of interest, low energy, and changes in sleep or appetite.
fields.advice: Reach out for support and consider speaking to a mental health professional.
fields.home_remedies: Gentle activity, regular routines, and engaging in small enjoyable activities.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If symptoms last more than two weeks or you have any thoughts of self-harm.

fields.name: Acute otitis media (ear infection)
fields.description: Infection of the middle ear, common in children but can affect adults.
fields.advice: Use pain relief if appropriate and keep the ear dry. Seek medical evaluation if pain is strong.
fields.home_remedies: Warm compress over the ear and rest.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If severe pain, fever, discharge from ear, or symptoms do not improve in 1–2 days.

fields.name: Dental cavity / tooth infection (suspected)
fields.description: Decay or infection in a tooth causing toothache and sometimes swelling.
fields.advice: Maintain oral hygiene and seek dental care as soon as possible.
fields.home_remedies: Warm salt-water rinses and avoiding very hot, cold, or sugary foods.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If pain is strong, persisting, or you have swelling or fever.

fields.name: Osteoarthritis-like joint pain
fields.description: Degenerative joint changes causing pain, stiffness, and reduced movement.
fields.advice: Maintain regular low-impact exercise and maintain a healthy weight.
fields.home_remedies: Warm or cold packs on joints and gentle stretching.
fields.when_to_see_doctor: If pain limits daily activities or joints become very swollen or deformed.
